summary:
## Mariana Trench: Earth's Deepest Spot

The Mariana Trench is the deepest place on Earth, located in the Pacific Ocean near the Mariana Islands. It's a crescent-shaped trench, about 1,600 miles long and 43 miles wide. The deepest point, called the Challenger Deep, is over 6,800 miles below the sea surfaceâ€”deeper than Mount Everest is tall!

The pressure at the bottom is incredibly high, over 1,000 times stronger than the pressure at sea level. Despite these extreme conditions, tiny organisms like single-celled monothalamea have been found living there.
title: Mariana Trench
